subject: RE: [junit] why are the Assert methods static?
msgSnippet: Thanks for the suggestions.  I don t know AspectJ (yet) but here s a good excuse to go learn it.  Or, I could just drop my obsession with extending the
messageBody:
Thanks for the suggestions. I don't know AspectJ (yet) but here's a
good excuse to go learn it. Or, I could just drop my obsession with
extending the assertXXX methods. ;-)


Todd.



________________________________

From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
Sent: Sunday, February 20, 2005 9:27 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] why are the Assert methods static?


James Abley wrote:
> Going back to the original question - how to log it. Could you
use
> AspectJ or similar so that you don't have to bother creating
your own
> version of all the assertXXX methods?

Thank you, James. Yes. I would recommend doing that. I'm no
AspectJ
expert, but I know one, and I have his book. (AspectJ in Action)
It's a
good read and a valuable guide. Definitely worth the investment.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
